channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bowen: Netanyahu is presiding over a divided Israel - the fault lines are now chasms
item.description: Jeremy Bowen travelled through Israel to hear views from all sides - from protesters in 'psychological despair' over Gaza, to those who feel an overwhelming sense that their country's actions are justified.

item.title: Far-right Israeli minister taunts prominent Palestinian prisoner
item.description: Video shows Itamar Ben Gvir telling the most prominent Palestinian prisoner Marwan Barghouti "you will not win".

item.title: War crimes likely committed in Syria coastal violence, UN says
item.description: A UN commission found war crimes were "likely" committed by former regime fighters and interim government force members in March.

item.title: Israeli settlement plans will 'bury' idea of Palestinian state, minister says
item.description: Far-right Israeli minister Bezalel Smotrich announced approval for 3,401 new homes in the controversial E1 area project in the occupied West Bank.

item.title: New Israeli rules stopping critical aid getting into Gaza, charities say
item.description: More than 100 aid organisations say they are increasingly being told they are "not authorised" to deliver supplies.

item.title: Gaza talks to focus on releasing hostages all in one go, Netanyahu hints
item.description: Mediators say a deal can be pushed through in the weeks before Israel's planned expansion of the war.

item.title: UK, France and Germany ready to reimpose sanctions on Iran over nuclear programme
item.description: If Iran does not re-engage in talks by the end of the month, sanctions will be reinstated, the E3 says.

item.title: Israel bombards Gaza City as UK and allies demand action against 'unfolding famine'
item.description: The countries demanded "immediate, permanent and concrete steps" to facilitate the entry of aid to Gaza.

item.title: UN condemns targeted Israeli attack that killed four Al Jazeera journalists
item.description: Israel says it targeted correspondent Anas al-Sharif, accusing him of leading a Hamas cell, which he had denied. Israel provided little evidence for the claim.

item.title: Who were the Al Jazeera journalists killed by Israel in Gaza?
item.description: Prominent reporter Anas al-Sharif and six other journalists were killed when Israel targeted a tent used by media, the broadcaster said.

item.title: Australia PM says Israel's Netanyahu 'in denial' about Gaza war
item.description: Albanese had earlier said Australia would recognise a Palestinian state at the UN General Assembly.

item.title: Australia to recognise Palestinian state in September
item.description: It follows similar moves by the UK, France and Canada.

item.title: Netanyahu defends Gaza plans as Israel heavily criticised at UN Security Council
item.description: Israel's Prime Minister also claimed Israeli hostages held in Gaza were "the only ones being deliberately starved".

item.title: Eleven more die from malnutrition in Gaza, Hamas-run health ministry says
item.description: Others were reported killed by Israeli operations, as an upcoming deadline for the evacuation of Gaza City has been reported.

item.title: Israel protesters intensify pressure against plan to expand Gaza war
item.description: Meanwhile in Gaza, five people, including two children, died in the past 24 hours from malnutrition, the Hamas-run health ministry said.

item.title: Bowen: Israeli settlers intensify campaign to drive out West Bank Palestinians
item.description: In the shadow of the Gaza war, violence is rising in the occupied territories as radical settlers seize land with the backing of the government.

item.title: 'Thank you, but it's too late': Why some Palestinians aren't convinced by Starmer's promise
item.description: Some say Britain's decision is an important first step – while others worry it won't make a real difference, writes BBC's International Editor Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: Gazan boy first to be treated in UK for war injuries
item.description: Majd, 15, was almost killed by an Israeli tank shell last February. He has finally arrived in the UK for reconstructive surgery.

item.title: US allies break with Trump to force diplomatic shift on Gaza
item.description: As Canada joins France and the UK with plans to recognise a Palestinian state, the US stands firmly with Israel - but does Trump have a long-term plan for Gaza's future?

item.title: The Gulf bets big on AI as it seeks the 'new oil'
item.description: The UAE and Saudi Arabia are partnering with the US to position themselves as AI hubs.

item.title: Gaza aid site offered a 'women only' day. It didn't stop the killing
item.description: Families say mothers Mary Sheikh al-Eid and Khadija Abu Anza were shot while seeking aid from GHF station in southern Gaza.

item.title: He went to get aid and didn't come back - stories of people killed in Gaza
item.description: As aid agencies warn of "mass starvation", the BBC hears from the relatives of some of those killed in the past week.

item.title: We might get killed, but we have to get food, injured Gazan tells BBC
item.description: Many patients brought to UK-Med's Gaza field hospital were seeking food aid but found only violence.

item.title: Iran's detainees in 'unbearable' conditions after Israeli strikes on prison
item.description: Iranian prisoners transferred to other facilities report overcrowding and unhygienic conditions.

item.title: Church leaders return with 'broken hearts' after rare visit to Gaza
item.description: The Latin and Greek Orthodox patriarchs of Jerusalem describing starving people not "batting an eyelid" at the sound of bombing.

item.title: 'They shot patients in beds' – BBC hears claims of massacre at Suweida hospital
item.description: The BBC visits Suweida's National Hospital where staff claim patients were killed by Syrian government forces.

item.title: The Today Debate: What can stop the war in Gaza
item.description: BBC Radio 4's Today programme presenter Nick Robinson discusses what can be done to stop the war in Gaza, with a panel of experts and politicians.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Israel's allies see evidence of war crimes in Gaza mounting up
item.description: The Middle East has been transformed since 7 October, and almost two years on, the conflict in Gaza is at another inflection point.

item.title: BBC sees fragile ceasefire holding in Syria's battle-scarred Suweida province
item.description: Sectarian clashes between Druze fighters and Bedouin militia began in the southern Syrian province about 10 days ago.

item.title: Watch: Palestinian and Israeli representatives address UN meeting
item.description: Riyad Mansour, Permanent Observer of Palestine to the UN, and Jonathan Miller, Deputy Permanent Representative for Israel to the UN, address a UN Security Council meeting.

item.title: Thousands protest in Israel over Gaza City occupation plan
item.description: BBC correspondent Emir Nader speaks to demonstrators against the Israel's plans for Gaza, including a former soldier who says he no longer supports the government.

item.title: Aerial footage shows Gaza in ruins
item.description: The Independent newspaper's Bel Trew told the BBC what she saw of the territory from above.

item.title: Two girls shot in Gaza - BBC pieces together what happened and looks at dozens more child shootings
item.description: Layan and Mira were killed in proximity to IDF soldiers - the Israeli military says intentional harm to civilians is prohibited and their cases will be examined by the authorities.

item.title: Gazan mother of malnourished baby speaks to BBC
item.description: Yasmeen Abu Sultan says her two-month old daughter is suffering from malnutrition and asked that she is taken out of Gaza to undertake medical treatment.

item.title: Relative of hostage responds to declarations of Palestinian statehood
item.description: Dalia Cusnir tells the BBC "the only way of securing the future of the region" is to return the hostages and force Hamas to down weapons.
